page.title: 11TURKEY FARMING
page.content: {Mr. Vickers}at{Hawkhill}gets his { {turkeys}at a few days old.He keeps them in a special unit with a heater which keeps the baby birds at the right temperature.When they are old enough they are moved to pens where each bird is allowed about 3 sq.ft. He uses suction watering methods and they are fed on sunflower seeds. He keeps them to varying stages of their development selling some to be fattened and keeping others until they are big enough to be eaten.Sometimes in cold weather the turkeys huddle together and suffocate so Mr.Vickers has to provide extra heat.One of his biggest problems is{rats}which attack and kill the turkeys.A new venture has been to introduce 2 pairs of{owls}into {surrounding woodland}to try to eliminate the rats without using {poison.
